intro: META is a token on Solana using the SPL token standard. The token retains mint authority indicating centralized control over token operations.

risk_factors: Has mint authority - tokens can be minted

authority_analyses.mint_authority: AuthorityAnalysis(address='21co44cadi5BCQ5bE45vR3Fjf1mkfryYnxq9G61MJhzj', authority_type='Wallet', capabilities=['Mint unlimited tokens', 'Change mint authority to any address', 'Burn tokens from any account', 'Full unilateral control (no multi-party approval required)'], multisig_info=None, governance_info=None, risk_assessment={'risk_level': 'high', 'reason': 'Single wallet control - centralized authority', 'mitigations': ['Has significant SOL balance - actively maintained']})
authority_analyses.update_authority: AuthorityAnalysis(address='21co44cadi5BCQ5bE45vR3Fjf1mkfryYnxq9G61MJhzj', authority_type='Wallet', capabilities=['Full unilateral control (no multi-party approval required)'], multisig_info=None, governance_info=None, risk_assessment={'risk_level': 'high', 'reason': 'Single wallet control - centralized authority', 'mitigations': ['Has significant SOL balance - actively maintained']})

recommendations: Consider decentralizing mint_authority - current setup is high risk
Consider decentralizing update_authority - current setup is high risk

key_findings: There is no freeze authority associated with the token contract.
The mint authority is also the address that has the ability to assign new minters, pausers, and more.
